abstract.para: This guide explains how to use &napp; and &uapp;.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &napp; and &uapp; are two applications that work hand in hand to keep your system up to date. &napp; is an application that will notify you when there are updates to installed packages and &uapp; will allow you to update these applications. Both &napp; and &uapp; are frontends to the Apt package management system for the K Desktop Environment (KDE).

There is no need to launch &napp;. It sits in your taskbar and will notify you when there are updates available. &uapp; will launch when &napp; is opened from the taskbar or by running sudo adept-updater from the command line or run line. Both applications require root access to run correctly.

sect2.title: Menu Bar
sect2.para: The Menu Bar provides the following menus and options:

listitem.para: Undo: Allows you to undo the last action. This button will change to Redo to allow you to redo the last action.
Hide Statusbar: Removes the statusbar from the bottom of &uapp; which displays information about the packages installed on your system, including the number of packages that need to be updated.
Configure Shortcuts: Allows for configuration of global shortcuts to help you out.
Adept Updater Handbook: Displays this handbook to help you figure out how to use &uapp;
Report a Bug: Launches a wizard to help report a bug via KDE's bug tracking system.
About Adept Updater: Launches the About Adept window
About KDE: Launches the About KDE window

sect1.title: Using Adept Updater
sect1.para: The two applications, &napp; and &uapp; work together to keep your system up to date. When there are updates available for your system &napp; will be displayed in the taskbar with a red triangle to notify you that there are updates available.
Upon notification that updates are available, simply double-click on &napp;, enter the root password, and &uapp; will open up.

Once &uapp; is open simply click on "Fetch List of Updates", and the updates will be downloaded. Once all of the apt-sources have been checked, &uapp; will display a list of packages that need to be updated. At this point, you can eitehr "Apply Updates" or "Forget Changes and Quit." If you choose to apply the changes, &uapp; will download the update and install them on your system.
